intro: Ibidium lucayanum, commonly known as the Lucayan ibidium, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
